intro: Cleistopholis verschuerenii, commonly known as the Schur's wild bean, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in shrubland and coastal habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and usually pale in color, while its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets. Cleistopholis verschuerenii is valued for its ecological role and has been used in traditional medicine.
